title: Processes - Average Value of a Function

content.question: If <math alttext="f of x equals the square root of x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi><mpadded><mo>(</mo><mpadded><mi>x</mi></mpadded><mo>)</mo></mpadded><mo>=</mo><msqrt><mi>x</mi></msqrt></math>, what is the average value of <math alttext="f" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>f</mi></math> on the interval <math alttext="open bracket, 0 comma t, close bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mo>[</mo><mn>0</mn><mo>,</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>]</mo></mrow></math> in terms of <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>t</mi></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="the fraction the square root of t, over t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction the square root of t, over 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 2 times the square root of t, over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

<math alttext="the fraction 2 t times the square root of t, over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="the fraction 2 times the square root of t, over 3" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mrow><mstyle displaystyle="true"><mrow><mfrac><mrow><mn>2</mn><msqrt><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></msqrt></mrow><mrow><mn>3</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mstyle></mrow></math>

topic.text: 8.1: Finding the Average Value of a Function on an Interval

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
